item.title: Bitcoin, not blockchain
item.description: It’s almost exactly seven years ago that I started my master graduate internship at Rabobank. My colleagues just finished some experiments with Ripple for cross-border payments and got enthusiastic about the potential that blockchain could offer. Although Bitcoin was the first and oldest application, I was led to believe that it was blockchain which was the innovation, not Bitcoin. Bitcoin was way too slow and energy intensive to be even considered any competition for the very efficient payment infrastructure we already had in the Netherlands in 2015.

item.title: Contribute through GitHub
item.description: Since I still do not possess all the knowledge about Bitcoin and Proof-of-Work myself, I made this website open-source. Everyone can contribute through GitHub by forking and submitting pull requests.
